alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Coastal Flagler; Coastal St. Johns; Eastern Alachua; Eastern Marion; Eastern Putnam; Inland Flagler; Inland St. Johns; Western Alachua; Western Marion; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Flagler, eastern Alachua, southern St. Johns, northern Marion and Putnam Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Saint Augustine South to near Melrose Landing. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph, pea size hail, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Palm Coast, Saint Augustine, Palatka, Flagler Beach, Bunnell, Crescent City, Interlachen, Pomona Park and Hastings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
